verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,
verses.web: LORD said, “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak this word, there:
verses.ct: The LORD said to Jeremiah, "Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and deliver this message:

verses.kjv: And say, Hear the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy people that enter in by these gates:
verses.web: ‘Hear LORD’s word, king of Judah, who sits on David’s throne, you, your servants, and your people who enter in by these gates.
verses.ct: "Listen to the word of the LORD, king of Judah — you who sit on David's throne, along with your officials and all the people who come through these gates.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Execute ye judgment and righteousness, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widow, neither shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.web: LORD says: “Execute justice and righteousness, and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong. Do no violence to the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow. Don’t shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.ct: The LORD says: Practice justice and do what is right. Rescue those who are being robbed from the power of their oppressors. Don't mistreat or abuse foreigners, orphans, or widows, and don't shed innocent blood in this place.

verses.kjv: For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.
verses.web: For if you do this thing indeed, then kings sitting on David’s throne will enter in by the gates of this house, riding in chariots and on horses, he, his servants, and his people.
verses.ct: If you truly do these things, then kings from David's line will continue to ride through the gates of this palace in chariots and on horses — they and their officials and their people.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith the LORD, that this house shall become a desolation.
verses.web: But if you will not hear these words, I swear by myself,” says LORD, “that this house will become a desolation.” ’ ”
verses.ct: But if you refuse to obey these commands, I swear by myself," declares the LORD, "that this palace will be reduced to rubble."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD unto the king’s house of Judah; Thou art Gilead unto me, and the head of Lebanon: yet surely I will make thee a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.
verses.web: For LORD says concerning the house of the king of Judah: “You are Gilead to me, the head of Lebanon. Yet surely I will make you a wilderness, cities which are not inhabited.
verses.ct: The LORD says this about the royal palace of Judah: "You are as valuable to me as Gilead, as prominent as the peaks of Lebanon. But I will turn you into a wasteland — a cluster of empty, abandoned cities.

verses.kjv: And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons: and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.
verses.web: I will prepare destroyers against you, everyone with his weapons, and they will cut down your choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.
verses.ct: I will send destroyers against you, each armed with weapons. They will chop down your finest cedars and throw them into the fire.

verses.kjv: And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every man to his neighbour, Wherefore hath the LORD done thus unto this great city?
verses.web: “Many nations will pass by this city, and they will each ask his neighbor, ‘Why has LORD done this to this great city?’
verses.ct: People from many nations will pass by this city and ask each other, 'Why did the LORD do this to such a great city?'

verses.kjv: Then they shall answer, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD their God, and worshipped other gods, and served them.
verses.web: Then they will answer, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of LORD their God, worshiped other gods, and served them.’ ”
verses.ct: And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD their God, worshiped other gods, and served them.'"

verses.kjv: Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him: but weep sore for him that goeth away: for he shall return no more, nor see his native country.
verses.web: Don’t weep for the dead. Don’t bemoan him; but weep bitterly for him who goes away, for he will return no more, and not see his native country.
verses.ct: Don't weep for the king who has died. Don't mourn for him. Instead, weep bitterly for the one being taken away, because he will never come back or see his homeland again.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD touching Shallum the son of Josiah king of Judah, which reigned instead of Josiah his father, which went forth out of this place; He shall not return thither any more:
verses.web: For LORD says touching Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, and who went out of this place: “He won’t return there any more.
verses.ct: The LORD says this about Shallum son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king after his father Josiah and was taken away from this place: "He will never return here.

verses.kjv: But he shall die in the place whither they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.
verses.web: But he will die in the place where they have led him captive. He will see this land no more.”
verses.ct: He will die in the land where they took him as a captive. He will never see this land again."

verses.kjv: Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by wrong; that useth his neighbour’s service without wages, and giveth him not for his work;
verses.web: “Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness, and his rooms by injustice; who uses his neighbor’s service without wages, and doesn’t give him his hire;
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for the one who builds his palace through injustice and adds rooms through exploitation — forcing his neighbors to work for nothing and refusing to pay them their wages!

verses.kjv: That saith, I will build me a wide house and large chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is cieled with cedar, and painted with vermilion.
verses.web: who says, ‘I will build myself a wide house and spacious rooms,’ and cuts out windows for himself; with a cedar ceiling, and painted with red.
verses.ct: He says, 'I'll build myself a grand palace with spacious upper rooms,' then cuts out large windows, panels it with cedar, and paints it bright red.

verses.kjv: Shalt thou reign, because thou closest thyself in cedar? did not thy father eat and drink, and do judgment and justice, and then it was well with him?
verses.web: “Should you reign, because you strive to excel in cedar? Didn’t your father eat and drink, and do justice and righteousness? Then it was well with him.
verses.ct: Does surrounding yourself with cedar make you a king? Your father ate and drank and lived well, but he also practiced justice and did what was right — and things went well for him.

verses.kjv: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well with him: was not this to know me? saith the LORD.
verses.web: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; so it was well, then. Wasn’t this to know me?” says LORD.
verses.ct: He defended the cause of the poor and the needy, and because of that, things went well. Isn't that what it means to truly know me?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But thine eyes and thine heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for to shed innocent blood, and for oppression, and for violence, to do it.
verses.web: But your eyes and your heart are only for your covetousness, for shedding innocent blood, for oppression, and for doing violence.”
verses.ct: "But your eyes and your heart care about nothing except your own greed, shedding innocent blood, and crushing people through oppression and violence."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah; They shall not lament for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! they shall not lament for him, saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!
verses.web: Therefore LORD says concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah: “They won’t lament for him, saying, ‘Ah my brother!’ or, ‘Ah sister!’ They won’t lament for him, saying ‘Ah lord!’ or, ‘Ah his glory!’
verses.ct: So the LORD says this about Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah: "No one will mourn for him, crying, 'Oh, my brother!' or 'Oh, my sister!' No one will grieve for him, saying, 'Oh, my lord!' or 'Oh, his majesty!'

verses.kjv: He shall be buried with the burial of an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.web: He will be buried with the burial of a donkey, drawn and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.”
verses.ct: He will be buried like a dead donkey — dragged away and dumped outside the gates of Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: Go up to Lebanon, and cry; and lift up thy voice in Bashan, and cry from the passages: for all thy lovers are destroyed.
verses.web: “Go up to Lebanon, and cry. Lift up your voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim; for all your lovers have been destroyed.
verses.ct: "Go up to Lebanon and cry out! Raise your voice in Bashan! Wail from Abarim! Because every one of your allies has been crushed.

verses.kjv: I spake unto thee in thy prosperity; but thou saidst, I will not hear. This hath been thy manner from thy youth, that thou obeyedst not my voice.
verses.web: I spoke to you in your prosperity; but you said, ‘I will not listen.’ This has been your way from your youth, that you didn’t obey my voice.
verses.ct: I warned you when you were comfortable and secure, but you said, 'I won't listen.' This has been your pattern since you were young — you have never obeyed my voice.

verses.kjv: The wind shall eat up all thy pastors, and thy lovers shall go into captivity: surely then shalt thou be ashamed and confounded for all thy wickedness.
verses.web: The wind will feed all your shepherds, and your lovers will go into captivity. Surely then you will be ashamed and confounded for all your wickedness.
verses.ct: The wind will sweep away all your leaders, and your allies will be dragged off into captivity. Then you will finally be ashamed and humiliated because of all your wickedness.

verses.kjv: O inhabitant of Lebanon, that makest thy nest in the cedars, how gracious shalt thou be when pangs come upon thee, the pain as of a woman in travail!
verses.web: Inhabitant of Lebanon, who makes your nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied you will be when pangs come on you, the pain as of a woman in travail!
verses.ct: You who live in luxury, nestled among the cedars of Lebanon — how you will groan when agony overtakes you, pain like a woman in labor!"

verses.kjv: As I live, saith the LORD, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet would I pluck thee thence;
verses.web: “As I live,” says LORD, “though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet on my right hand, I would still pluck you from there.
verses.ct: "As surely as I live," declares the LORD, "even if Coniah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still rip you off.

verses.kjv: And I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them whose face thou fearest, even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.web: I would give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of them of whom you are afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: I will hand you over to those who want you dead — the very people you're terrified of — to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and to the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: And I will cast thee out, and thy mother that bare thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die.
verses.web: I will cast you out with your mother who bore you into another country, where you were not born; and there you will die.
verses.ct: I will throw you and the mother who gave birth to you into a foreign country where neither of you was born, and that is where you will die.

verses.kjv: But to the land whereunto they desire to return, thither shall they not return.
verses.web: But to the land to which their soul longs to return, there they will not return.”
verses.ct: They will ache to return to this land, but they will never come back."

verses.kjv: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into a land which they know not?
verses.web: Is this man Coniah a despised broken vessel? Is he a vessel in which no one delights? Why are they cast out, he and his offspring, and cast into a land which they don’t know?
verses.ct: Is this man Coniah nothing but a shattered, worthless pot? A jar that nobody wants? Why have he and his children been thrown out and flung into a land they've never known?

verses.kjv: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of the LORD.
verses.web: O earth, earth, earth, hear LORD’s word!
verses.ct: O earth, earth, earth — hear the word of the LORD!

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Write ye this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days: for no man of his seed shall prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling any more in Judah.
verses.web: LORD says, “Record this man as childless, a man who will not prosper in his days; for no more will a man of his offspring prosper, sitting on David’s throne, and ruling in Judah.”
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Record this man as childless — a man who will never succeed in his lifetime. None of his descendants will ever prosper, sit on David's throne, or rule over Judah again."
